title: WNBA Finals Game 3 takeaways: How Aces beat Mercury to go up 3-0
content: Everything that happened in Game 3, including A'ja Wilson's historic night and Satou Sabally's injury.

title: Jays knock out Yankees, reach 1st ALCS since '16
content: The Blue Jays advanced to the club's first ALCS since 2016 after defeating the Yankees 5-2 on Wednesday.

title: Yankees left in disbelief: 'Didn't finish the goal'
content: The Yankees believed this team was more talented and more complete than the club that went to the World Series a year ago, but they saw their season end Wednesday night in the ALDS.

title: Schwarber's 2 blasts revive Phils in must-win G3
content: Kyle Schwarber snapped an 0-for-8 skid in the NLDS with two homers Wednesday night, helping the Phillies avoid a sweep with an 8-2 win over the Dodgers in Game 3.

title: Kershaw roughed up in relief in 'hard to watch' 8th
content: Clayton Kershaw's first relief appearance since 2019 wasn't pretty, as he allowed four runs in a nightmarish eighth inning in the Phillies' 8-2 Game 3 victory.

title: Wilson rewards Aces' trust with last-second winner
content: A'ja Wilson made a turnaround jumper with 0.3 seconds left, capping a stellar 34-point night and lifting the Aces over the Mercury 90-88 on Wednesday for a 3-0 lead in the WNBA Finals.

title: UNC backs Belichick as talk swirls amid 2-3 start
content: Amid a chaotic week, North Carolina and head coach Bill Belichick released a joint statement Wednesday night, with the Tar Heels saying he has "the full support" of the UNC administration.

title: Sources: Jags get Newsome; Campbell to Browns
content: The Jaguars and Browns agreed to a trade of cornerbacks Wednesday night, with Greg Newsome heading to Jacksonville and Tyson Campbell going to Cleveland, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: 'Fail Mary' backlash still hurts Bears' Stevenson
content: Bears cornerback Tyrique Stevenson says the backlash he received for his role in tipping a Hail Mary pass against the Commanders last season "still hurts."

title: 😡 Bottom 10: Not-So-Happy Valley these days
content: Another loss by Penn State put the Nittany Lions -- and the Bottom 10 committee -- in a bit of a predicament.

title: Wyshynski predicts every NHL team's finish in 2025-26
content: As the season begins, we reveal which teams will make the Stanley Cup Final, the playoffs and the draft lottery.

title: 'I have not been back yet': Why Georgia fans haven't forgiven Auburn 39 years later
content: In 1986, Auburn sprayed hoses at Bulldogs fans, including current QB Gunner Stockton's grandfather, and they haven't forgotten it.

title: The latest buzz around the NFL: Insiders on Geno Smith, Daniel Jones and extensions on the horizon
content: Are the Raiders worried about Smith? Can Jones keep rolling? Which players could get extended soon? And which coordinators might get head coaching interest?

title: Our NFL trade grades: Who won the Browns-Jaguars swap of cornerbacks?
content: We're grading NFL deals leading into the Nov. 4 NFL trade deadline, including the Browns and Jaguars' exchange of fifth-year corners.

title: Kung Fu, meditation and a 'Dream Shake': Inside Victor Wembanyama's return
content: A 'traumatic experience' with deep vein thrombosis prompted a summer of exploration for the Spurs star.

title: Stephanie 'La Primera' Vaquer's WWE career marked by historic firsts
content: Stephanie Vaquer shares her path to WWE, and how a memorable night in Indianapolis helped her fulfill "the dream of my life."

title: UWCL talking points: Does Melchie Dumornay's demolition of Arsenal make her world-class?
content: Emily Keogh, Julien Laurens and Sam Marsden answer some of our burning questions after the first round of the UEFA Women's Champions League.

title: A dream Champions League debut for Le Tissier and Man United
content: Bigger tests will come, but for now Maya Le Tissier & Co., will revel in Manchester United's perfect start.

title: Eli Manning in 'Chad Powers' reminds us to believe
content: Eli Manning, a two-time Super Bowl MVP and NFL legend, on "Chad Powers" and the possibility of second chances.

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in, who's out, who has work to do in each league﻿
content: Putting the spotlight on select teams and questions around others as the early playoff picture takes shape.

title: He could go all the ... what?!? 7 times an NFL player dropped the ball short of the end zone
content: Emari Demercado, Adonai Mitchell and Jonathan Taylor will share the field Sunday and a bond they'd rather forget.

title: Buzz: Barkley not on injury report, Tracy set to return for TNF
content: No injury designation for Saquon Barkley for TNF; Tyrone Tracy Jr. expected to return after missing two games.

title: Facts vs. Feelings: Patience is a virtue. Until it isn't
content: If your team isn't winning, shake things up. These seven players might offer sneaky start or trade value.

title: 'Beyond repair': Napheesa Collier, Cathy Engelbert and a WNBA teetering on the brink
content: Amid the WNBA Finals, two of the most powerful people in the game are locked in a contentious battle -- for public opinion, power and money.

title: Win projections for all 30 NBA teams: How we see the East, West playing out
content: ESPN NBA analyst Kevin Pelton unveils his annual win projections for all 30 teams. Where does your team land?

title: Giannis Antetokounmpo has finally put the Milwaukee Bucks on the clock
content: In a transformative summer for the Bucks, the team had discussions about moving the two-time MVP to New York.

title: Leicester's Premier League win, 10 years later: How did they do it, and could a team repeat it?
content: Leicester's stunning title win remains one of the great underdog stories in sports. What do the players who made it happen think of their achievement today? And will we ever see a team match their feat?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool linked with move for Semenyo
content: Liverpool are reportedly looking to sign Bournemouth winger Antoine Semenyo. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Survivor pool strategy: Packers, Broncos among top options in Week 6
content: NFL survivor pool strategy, predictions and picks for ESPN Eliminator Challenge Week 6, including teams to pick or save for later.

title: Latest rosters for 90+ teams: Transfers, recruits and more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're updating key rosters as players arrive on campus for the 2025-26 season.

title: 11 freshmen with the most impact -- including three from Stanford
content: Why Jazzy Davidson could make the biggest impact -- and all three Stanford recruits make these preseason rankings.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Bigg Boss Kannada studio unsealed after DCM D.K. Shivakumar steps in, filming resumes
content: The studio will be given time to address violations in accordance with the norms set by the Karnataka State Pollution Control Board, Mr. Shivakumar had said in a post on X.

title: PM Modi holds talks with U.K. counterpart Starmer in Mumbai
content: The British PM said the free trade deal is a “launchpad” for two-way growth, with India set to be the third biggest global economy by 2028

title: Mumbai Metro Line-3 becomes completely operational
content: Mumbai Metro Line-3 Phase 2B, connecting Cuffe Parade to Aarey JVLR underground, is now fully operational

title: 458 people dead as Jharkhand witnesses heaviest monsoon in a decade, climate change blamed
content: According to figures compiled from various state departments, 186 people were killed by lightning strikes, while 178 drowned in rain-related incidents. Floods, landslips, and house collapses accounted for the remaining casualties.

title: Goa AAP rules out alliance with Congress over defection concerns
content: The Aam Aadmi Party's comments came after its Goa working president Rajesh Kalangutkar resigned from his post and the outfit on Wednesday

title: Cough syrup deaths: Supreme Court agrees to hear PIL seeking CBI probe, nationwide drug safety review
content: The plea seeks court's direction to the central government to identify the regulatory failures that allowed substandard medicines to reach the market.

title: Demolition underway of illegal properties in Gandhinagar
content: The police had detained nearly 60 persons for the clash and rioting that occurred in the village. More than 200 people were involved in the rioting, in which several vehicles and shops were damaged and some were set on fire, the police had said.

title: Kerala government announces free travel for cancer patients in KSRTC buses
content: Transport Minister tells Assembly that patients can avail themselves of ticket-free travel by producing certification from oncologist and submitting it to KSRTC bus crew as proof of their medical condition

title: 7-year-old boy dies in fire at private residential school in Kodagu
content: The fire was noticed when students were sleeping inside their room. While several children managed to run to safety with the help of school staff, Pushpak reportedly failed to escape in time and sustained burns.

title: Sri Lankan Navy arrests 30 Indian fishermen from Rameswaram, seizes trawlers
content: Fishermen leaders demand Union Government immediately speak to the Sri Lankan Government and secure their release

title: Kerala Assembly disrupted for fourth day; Opposition stages walkout over Sabarimala gold-plating row
content: As soon as Question Hour commenced, Opposition Leader raised the Sabarimala issue and demanded a public apology from CM over certain remarks made in the House a day ago, which were perceived as body-shaming by Opposition

title: Afghan Foreign Minister Muttaqi arrives in Delhi
content: In January, the Taliban regime described India as an "important" regional and economic power following talks between Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri and Mr. Muttaqi.

title: Supreme Court opens the door for young talents to be appointed District Judges
content: The Bench directs States to reframe their service rules in consultation with the respective High Courts within three months

title: 'Jhund' film actor Priyanshu aka Babu Chhetri murdered by friend after brawl; accused held
content: Sahu and Chhetri travelled by Sahu's motorcycle to an abandoned house in the Jaripatka area for a drinking session. This occurred a few hours before Chhetri was found injured early Wednesday morning, the police said

title: PM Modi welcomes agreement on Trump's peace plan for Gaza
content: "We hope the release of hostages and enhanced humanitarian assistance to the people of Gaza will bring respite to them and pave the way for lasting peace," PM Modi said.

title: Cough syrup deaths: Sresan Pharma owner G. Ranganathan arrested in Chennai
content: Ranganathan’s 2,000 sq ft manufacturing facility located along the Chennai-Bengaluru Highway has been sealed, while his registered office in Kodambakkam remains shut

title: Porsche car crash case exposed systemic corruption: Pune Police Commissioner
content: ‘It also demonstrated how the police, working within the same system, managed to uncover the entire nexus behind the replacement of the juvenile’s blood samples with those of his mother,’ says Amitesh Kumar, Police Commissioner

title: Kerala seeks ₹700-crore package from Centre for tourism development
content: Tourism Minister Mohamed Riyas says Kerala hopes to invite PM Modi to inaugurate a planned wellness conclave and that State government will set a date that does not conflict with the impending local body elections code of conduct

title: Kerala CM leads LDF delegation to Delhi for talks on State’s development
content: Pinarayi to meet Narendra Modi, Amit Shah and Nitin Gadkari. Minister Mohamed Riyas says in Delhi that prime focus of meetings is on forging a consensus between Central and State governments for Kerala’s development

title: U.K. PM India visit LIVE: Keir Starmer meets Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Mumbai
content: The British Film Institute (BFI) on Wednesday, October 8, hailed a pact agreed with the National Film Development Corporation (NFDC) during U.K. Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s visit to Mumbai.

title: Rajnath Singh arrives in Canberra to boost India-Australia defence, strategic ties
content: “We reviewed the full spectrum of India-Australia defence cooperation, including defence industry, cyber defence, maritime security and regional challenges,” Defence Minister Rajnath Singh wrote on X

title: Cough syrup deaths: IMA demands Nadda's intervention, withdrawal of case against pediatrician
content: The IMA President pointed out that the Supreme Court's laid down a proper procedure to be followed prior to arresting a doctor is lacking in this case

title: Bihar Assembly election LIVE: Congress meet clears 25 candidates amid seat-sharing talks with RJD
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) will facilitate the elderly, Persons with Disabilities (PwDs), and service electors to vote using postal ballots in the Bihar Assembly polls

title: What was behind the ‘I Love Muhammad’ movement? | Explained
content: How did the protests spread to other cities and States? How have Muslim bodies and political parties reacted?

title: Are workers’ rights being eroded? | Explained
content: What happened at the Sigachi Industries chemical factory in Telangana when a chemical reactor burst? What has the International Labour Organization (ILO) said about industrial accidents? What laws are in place in India that protect workers’ rights?

title: State government intends to Tamil Nadu a quality capital: TRB Rajaa
content: Mr. Rajaa said Tamil Nadu has doubled its exports to $52 billion from $26 billion in the last four years, with $14.6 billion coming from electronics.

title: Supreme Court overturns death sentence of Chennai man accused for rape and murder
content: The Chengalpattu Sessions Court sentenced him to death on February 19, 2018, and the Madras High Court upheld it on July 10, 2018

title: India’s invasive aliens problem complicates wait to understand scope
content: Conservation researchers, practitioners, and policymakers in India face a dilemma. As one scientist put it: should they wait to document the effects of all these species to prepare a conservation plan or should they document and conserve in parallel?

title: Trinamool takes fight to Tripura: Delegation visits Agartala party office ‘vandalised by BJP’
content: Delegation stranded at Agartala airport after convoy allegedly held back; West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee accuses ‘double-engine BJP government’ in Tripura of restraining their movement

title: Rakesh Kishore, a septuagenarian lawyer who is ‘unknown’ in legal circle and ‘invisible’ in society
content: He praises the Yogi government’s ‘bulldozer action’ against Muslims in Bareilly, calling it ‘the only way to deliver justice in present times’

title: Tourism takes a hit as the hills of north Bengal reel under the aftermath of floods
content: Hospitality industry members say the tourism industry in the hills lost close to 50 crore in the three days after the floods

title: The Hindu set to host property expo in Singapore on October 11, 12
content: The expo aims to bring together top developers, luxury property brands, and industry experts under one roof

title: Six workers, proprietor killed in explosion at firecracker unit in Konaseema district of A.P.
content: A short circuit in the electrical wiring system at the unit reportedly led to the accident; three more workers with 90% of burn injuries battle for life

title: Google’s subsidiary Raiden Infotech to set up ₹87,520-crore data centre in Vizag
content: State Investment Promotion Board approves investment proposals worth ₹1.14 lakh crore, with a potential of createing employment for 67,000 people

title: YSRCP, TDP clash at VMC meet on social welfare pensions
content: YSRCP corporators allege no new pensions have been sanctioned since the NDA government took charge; council also discusses diarrhoea outbreak and civic works in Vijayawada.

title: Andhra Pradesh government ready to resolve teachers’ issues, says  Lokesh
content: Teachers thank the HRD Minister for smooth inter-district transfers and long-awaited promotions; he urges them to focus on students’ performance

title: Neriamangalam-Valara stretch is on revenue land, says govt. affidavit
content: The Kerala High Court had earlier restricted widening works on the stretch following the govt.’s previous affidavit, stating that the road was on reserve forest land

title: W.B. Governor meets President says law and order in the State is being strangulated
content: Speaking to media persons in Delhi, Dr. Bose evaded questions on the imposition of President Rule under Article 356 in West Bengal. However, the Governor added the Constitution of India has enough provisions to deal with the situation

title: Ecuador President unharmed in attack on motorcade
content: President Daniel Noboa was inaugurating a water treatment plant in central Ecuador when his motorcade was set on by a large group protesting against rising fuel prices

title: APHERMC fines Mohan Babu University ₹15 Lakh, recommends withdrawal of recognition
content: University told to refund ₹26.17 crore collected from students between 2022-23 to September 30, 2024 within 15 days; Pro-Chancellor Vishnu Manchu calls findings by Commission panel mere recommendations

title: “Shiv Sena (UBT) protests against Mahayuti govt aid package for farmers, calls it “misleading”
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) allies Congress and NCP (SP) also called the relief package “hollow” and asked for something “substantial”

title: Veterans take exception to Mohanlal’s appearance while receiving Army Chief’s commendation card
content: Another veteran said that “officers of the regular and territorial army are not allowed to wear beards, unless you are a Sikh officer in which case you wear a turban too”

title: Eight injured in scooter explosion in Kanpur market, illegal firecrackers recovered
content: Preliminary investigations have revealed that firecrackers were being illegally stored and sold in the area

title: Fire breaks out at playschool building near Katpadi
content: Police said that a playschool is run on the ground floor of the building, whereas a real estate office is located on the first floor.

title: Work to convert overhead power lines into underground cables around temple nears completion
content: Officials of Tangedco, which executes the work, say that it has been a traditional practice to enforce regular power cuts to houses on key stretches around the temple during festival season to prevent any untoward incidents like electrocution of pilgrims during their visit to the temple.

title: Brief spell of heavy rain throws life out of gear in Vijayawada
content: City receives around 40 mm rain in the evening; commuters, including students, have tough time getting rides

title: Ayodhya represents India’s cultural soul, says Nirmala Sitharaman
content: Union Finance Minister and Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath unveil statues of South Indian music saints

title: Multiple FIRs registered in Punjab on objectionable social media content targeting CJI
content: Social media content relating to attacks on a Constitutional authority, caste-based vilification and incitement, and unjustly exploiting caste and communal sentiments were flagged

title: Two soldiers go missing in Chenab Valley snowstorm during anti-terror operation
content: The operation to trace the missing soldiers is underway on both flanks of the mountains, from the Kishtwar side in the Jammu division and the Kokernag side in the Kashmir division, officials said

title: Odisha to restore Rabindranath Tagore’s residence in Puri
content: The seaside home narrowly escaped demolition by the Puri Municipality after a campaign to preserve it; the property will now be converted into a museum

title: Election Commission to facilitate elderly, PwD, and service voters to vote using postal ballot in Bihar Assembly polls
content: The electors on essential services on the date of poll can apply for the postal ballot facility through the designated nodal officer of their respective department

title: Congress meet clears 25 candidates for Bihar elections amid seat-sharing talks with RJD
content: The cleared candidates are for seats in traditional Congress strongholds and will be announced after consultation with alliance partners, say party’s Bihar leaders; insist there is no fight for seats within alliance

title: British Airways to launch third daily London-Delhi flight in 2026, boosting U.K.-India trade amid PM Starmer’s visit
content: IndiGo to enhance connectivity to Manchester with flights from New Delhi from November 15 in addition to thrice weekly flights from Mumbai

title: Draft labour policy unites social security schemes
content: It aims at creating universal, portable social security accounts for all workers by 2030; it also seeks to raise women’s labour participation to 35%, offer single-window digital compliance for MSMEs

title: ED cracks down on fake summons scam with new QR code verification system
content: Multiple instances have come to the notice of the ED wherein certain ‘unscrupulous’ persons have sent summonses to individuals with the motive of cheating or extortion

title: 'Israel can't fight world, Bibi': How Trump struck Gaza deal; US Prez recounts call
content: President Trump announced a Gaza ceasefire deal signed by Israel and Hamas, marking the first phase of a peace plan. The agreement includes the release of all hostages held by Hamas in exchange for Palestinian prisoners and an Israeli troop withdrawal. This development aims to end the ongoing conflict and facilitate humanitarian aid.

title: Cough syrup deaths: Licence of Sresan Pharmaceuticals, makers of Coldrif, cancelled
content: Tamil Nadu health minister confirmed the permanent revocation of Sresan Pharmaceuticals' license, maker of Coldrif cough syrup, following the deaths of at least 21 children in Madhya Pradesh. The company's owner has been arrested, and its manufacturing facility, found with serious safety lapses, has been sealed.

title: 'Not applicable for couple who ...': Supreme Court clarifies age criteria for surrogacy
content: The Supreme Court has ruled that age restrictions in surrogacy law do not apply retrospectively. Couples who had frozen embryos before the law's enactment can now proceed with surrogacy, offering relief to three families. The court questioned the rationale behind age limits for surrogacy, especially when none exist for natural procreation.

title: ‘Major breakthrough’: Pak's ISI-backed terror network busted in Punjab; IED recovered
content: Punjab Police's Counter-Intelligence unit has busted a Babbar Khalsa International terror module, apprehending two operatives and recovering 2.5 kg of IED. This operation, linked to UK-based handlers and a BKI mastermind, aimed to disrupt targeted attacks. Separately, Amritsar police dismantled a cross-border arms and narcotics smuggling ring, seizing heroin and sophisticated pistols intended for local criminals.

title: AI bets: Nvidia CEO on Elon Musk’s xAI; says his ‘only regret’ was not investing big
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang expressed strong enthusiasm for Elon Musk's AI startup xAI, regretting not investing more aggressively. He confirmed Nvidia is an investor, clarifying it's a strategic bet, not vendor financing. Huang also highlighted the early stages of the AI revolution and Nvidia's continuous scouting for promising startups.

title: Smriti Mandhana on verge of breaking 28-year record at World Cup
content: Indian opener Smriti Mandhana is on the verge of a major record. She needs just 12 runs to surpass Belinda Clark's mark for most runs in a calendar year in women's ODIs. Mandhana has already amassed 959 runs in 2025. She is also nearing 5,000 ODI runs, a milestone achieved by only Mithali Raj.

title: India-Afghan ties: Taliban FM arrives in New Delhi; EAM extends 'warm welcome'
content: Afghanistan's Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi arrived in India for a significant visit, the first by a top Taliban leader since 2021. This marks a deepening of engagement between India and the Taliban government, with discussions planned on bilateral relations and regional issues. India, a long-time provider of humanitarian aid, is set to explore further cooperation during Muttaqi's stay.

title: Delhi molestation case: Judge recuses from hearing Chaitanyanand Saraswati's bail plea
content: Chaitanyanand Saraswati, accused of molesting 17 students, faces serious allegations including secret photography and lewd chats. He allegedly lured victims with job promises and used a CCTV app to spy on them. Saraswati, who was on the run, also faces charges of honey-trapping and misleading investigators.

title: Trade war heats up: US targets Chinese tech firms; Beijing vows ‘necessary measures’
content: The Trump administration has expanded export restrictions to include subsidiaries of Chinese tech companies on the entity list, aiming to close loopholes. This move targets firms like Huawei and DJI, impacting tens of thousands of entities and drawing sharp condemnation from Beijing as US-China tech tensions escalate.

title: Mumbai: Sweeper caught performing ECG at Chembur hospital
content: The Maharashtra State Human Rights Commission fined the BMC Rs 12 lakh for using a sweeper to operate an ECG machine at a Mumbai hospital. The commission cited negligence and violation of human rights, demanding immediate appointment of a trained technician and compensation for patients.

title: South Delhi murder: Woman stabbed multiple times, killed in flat; male friend on the run
content: A 25-year-old woman, Sakshi, was found dead with multiple stab wounds in her south Delhi rented accommodation. Police suspect a male friend's involvement after hearing loud noises and finding bloodstains. The suspect is absconding, and a manhunt is underway.

title: Greatest of era: 'More off-field battles' - Ex-England star picks Kohli over Tendulkar
content: Former England bowler Steve Harmison has declared Virat Kohli the greatest cricketer of the last three decades, placing him above Sachin Tendulkar. Harmison cited Kohli's resilience under scrutiny and adaptability to modern cricket's demands as key factors. He also supported Kohli and Rohit Sharma against calls to play domestic cricket.

title: Amazon founder Bezos: I always advise to young people, 'Go work at ...'
content: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos advises young aspiring entrepreneurs to gain foundational experience by working at McDonald's. He emphasizes that such roles teach crucial skills like responsibility, discipline, and customer interaction, which are vital for long-term success and often overlooked in the pursuit of rapid startup growth.

title: Karwa Chauth 2025: 14 unique gifts to make your wife feel special
content: Karwa Chauth, a cherished festival of love and devotion, sees women fasting for their husbands' well-being. This year, husbands can express their appreciation through thoughtful gifts. From elegant handbags and delicate jewellery to modern tech gadgets and luxurious skincare, explore memorable presents that celebrate your wife's style and your enduring bond, making this Karwa Chauth truly unforgettable.

title: 'Imagined words': Chidambaram slams PM Modi's remarks on 26/11 attacks; BJP hits back
content: Former Home Minister P Chidambaram has strongly refuted Prime Minister Narendra Modi's claims that the UPA government halted a military strike on Pakistan after the 26/11 attacks due to foreign pressure. Chidambaram stated that the Prime Minister's reported words were "terribly wrong" and imagined, accusing Modi of twisting facts for political gain.

title: Bank holiday on Karva Chauth: Will banks remain shut on Oct 10?
content: As Diwali approaches, numerous bank holidays are scheduled across India. While Karva Chauth sees closures only in Himachal Pradesh, the following weeks bring widespread bank shutdowns for Diwali, Naraka Chaturdashi, Kali Puja, Govardhan Pooja, and Bhaidooj. Customers should consult the RBI's holiday list to plan banking needs effectively amidst these festive closures.

title: ‘Karthi Anna’ to the rescue: How GM played silent role in R Vaishali's Grand Swiss glory
content: Vaishali Rameshbabu, a top Indian Grandmaster, nearly withdrew from a major tournament after a string of losses. Her childhood coach, RB Ramesh, enlisted fellow Grandmaster Karthikeyan Murali, known as "Karthi Anna," to encourage her. His timely support helped Vaishali regain confidence, defend her title, and secure a spot in the Women's Candidates 2026.

title: Karwa Chauth 2025: 10 never-before-seen Mehendi designs
content: If you're looking for the latest Karva Chauth mehndi designs, then you’ve landed on the right page, as we have fresh and quirky Karva Chauth mehndi ideas that will instantly make your hands look iconic.

title: 'No note found': Bengaluru cop dies by suicide at home; served as BJP leader's driver
content: A 34-year-old police head constable, Sharanappa Ramagol, attached to the City Armed Reserve and serving as a driver for BJP leader R Ashoka's escort vehicle, was found dead by suicide at his Byatarayanapura residence. His brother-in-law discovered the body hanging in the bedroom. No suicide note was recovered.

title: Telangana bus fare hike: BRS working president KT Rama Rao put under house arrest
content: BRS Working President KT Rama Rao has reportedly been placed under house arrest in Hyderabad ahead of a planned protest against a recent RTC bus fare hike. The party claims heavy security surrounds his residence. Rama Rao had previously criticized the Congress government for the increase, calling it insensitive to the poor and middle class.

title: Gujarat horror: 3 men gang-rape 50-year-old widow twice in Una
content: A 50-year-old widow in Una was allegedly gangraped twice by three fishermen within 24 hours. The incident came to light when she sought medical treatment for severe abdominal pain. The accused offered her a ride home, then took her to a secluded spot and later to one of their houses, where the assaults occurred before she was threatened into silence.

title: 'Prove you're serious!' - Ashwin tells Rohit, Virat to play domestic cricket
content: Ravichandran Ashwin backs the BCCI's decisions regarding Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's ODI futures, emphasising long-term planning for the 2027 World Cup. He suggests domestic tournaments like the Vijay Hazare Trophy are crucial for the veterans to prove their commitment and form, while also endorsing Shubman Gill's captaincy for future leadership grooming.

title: 'Paves way for peace': PM welcomes deal on 1st phase of Trump's Gaza peace plan; praises Netanyahu
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has welcomed the initial phase of US President Donald Trump's Gaza peace plan, expressing optimism for enduring peace.  Modi lauded the agreement, which follows prolonged conflict, and highlighted the release of hostages and increased humanitarian aid as crucial steps. He also acknowledged the leadership of PM Netanyahu in this development.

title: 'No issues with fitness' - Shami breaks silence after missing squad again
content: Pacer Mohammed Shami has been overlooked for India's upcoming tour of Australia, sparking speculation. Shami, addressing the non-selection on his YouTube channel, stated his fitness is good and he is practicing. However, former batter Aakash Chopra expressed doubts about his return to the national team due to a lack of recent international match practice.

title: Dangerous ingredients to watch out for in a cough syrup, warns FDA
content: Millions rely on cough syrups, but some ingredients pose serious risks. Codeine, a narcotic, can lead to addiction and death. Dextromethorphan, while safe in doses, is abused for hallucinogenic effects. Promethazine causes severe drowsiness and respiratory issues, especially in children. Diphenhydramine can trigger heart problems and seizures. Diethylene glycol, an industrial chemical, is highly toxic and can be fatal.

title: 'Send Musk, Trump & Netanyahu to space…': What Goodall said in her final interview
content: Legendary conservationist Jane Goodall, in her final interview, humorously suggested sending world leaders like Elon Musk, Donald Trump, and Vladimir Putin on a SpaceX flight. Her witty remark underscored her deep frustration with global conflicts and policies harming people and the environment, reflecting her lifelong advocacy for peace and conservation.

title: Cough syrup row: Owner of pharma company that supplied 'poisonous' Coldrif arrested
content: G Ranganathan, owner of Sresan Pharmaceuticals, has been arrested by a Madhya Pradesh team in connection with the toxic Coldrif cough syrup linked to 21 deaths. Ranganathan, a veteran in the pharmaceutical industry known for his nutritional syrup Pronit, faces scrutiny as his manufacturing unit has been sealed and his office cleared out.

title: Gold & silver price prediction: Will MCX Gold, MCX Silver hit fresh highs?
content: Gold and silver price prediction today: Gold and silver prices are exhibiting strong bullish momentum, reaching new highs driven by global economic uncertainty, geopolitical tensions, and central bank diversification. Gold is targeting ₹1,27,000 on MCX, while silver eyes ₹1,56,000, supported by robust industrial and investment demand. Both metals are poised for continued upward trajectory.

title: High-speed collision: Porsche racing BMW crashes on Mumbai's Western Express Highway
content: A Porsche, reportedly racing a BMW, crashed into a divider on Mumbai's Western Express Highway, its front section destroyed. In Delhi, a biker was killed by a speeding Thar that fled the scene. Investigations are underway for both incidents.

title: Ayesha Curry sparks outrage with family photos after controversial remarks
content: NBA star Stephen Curry's wife, Ayesha, has ignited fan fury with a recent Instagram post after previously admitting she didn't want marriage or children. Her "Life lately" caption, featuring family photos, drew sharp criticism, with followers questioning her sincerity and urging Stephen to reconsider their union. The couple has remained silent amidst the backlash.

title: Two years of war in Gaza: 67,000 dead, millions displaced
content: Two years into Israel's Gaza campaign following the October 7th attacks, the territory faces a devastating humanitarian crisis. Over 67,000 Palestinians, including thousands of children, have perished, with widespread famine and displacement impacting nearly the entire population. Essential services have collapsed, and development has regressed by decades, leaving millions in dire need.

title: North Bengal floods: Toll rises to 40 as more bodies found; many still in relief camps
content: North Bengal floods have claimed 40 lives, with two more bodies found in Jalpaiguri. Thousands are in relief camps, while damaged infrastructure hampers train services. Displaced residents express frustration over inadequate aid and delayed surveys, prompting ministerial intervention. Forest officials are also taking precautions against wildlife.

title: Watch: Rubio whispers, gives urgent note to Trump; moments before Gaza deal was announced
content: President Trump announced a US-brokered Israel-Hamas peace deal's first phase, promising hostage releases and troop withdrawals.  A whispered note from Secretary of State Marco Rubio preceded the announcement, urging a Truth Social post.  Trump hailed the deal as a path to "everlasting peace," thanking Qatar, Egypt, and Turkey for their mediation efforts.

title: Trade war: White House drops generic drug tariffs; eases pain for US patients & Indian pharma
content: The Trump administration has abandoned plans for tariffs on imported generic drugs, a move bringing significant relief to Indian pharmaceutical companies. This decision averts potential price hikes and shortages for millions of Americans relying on affordable Indian generics for various health conditions, highlighting India's crucial role as the largest supplier of these essential medicines to the US.

title: Chennai: TVK chief Vijay gets bomb threat; police launch manhunt
content: Actor-politician Vijay's residence received a bomb threat, declared a hoax by police. This follows a string of similar false alarms targeting prominent figures and locations in Chennai, including the Chief Minister and Governor. Authorities are actively investigating the source of these disruptive emails, ensuring public safety amidst the scare.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex near 81,800
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened in green on Thursday. While Nifty50 was above 25,050, BSE Sensex was just below 81,800.

title: Kanpur blast: 8 injured after scooter carrying firecrackers explodes
content: A powerful firecracker blast in Kanpur's Meston Road market injured eight people, with four in critical condition and airlifted to Lucknow. The explosion, originating from a scooter, damaged vehicles and several shops, causing panic. Authorities are investigating all angles, with forensic and anti-sabotage teams examining the scene.

title: Australia visit: Rajnath witnesses F-35 refuelling onboard Australian aircraft
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh witnessed mid-air refuelling of an F-35 fighter jet aboard an Australian RAAF tanker aircraft. This event highlights India-Australia defence cooperation, with both nations signing an agreement for air-to-air refuelling. Singh's visit to Canberra further strengthens bilateral defence ties and strategic coordination.

title: Interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS is leaking water in space; Nasa calls it unprecedented
content: Astronomers are stunned by interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS releasing water vapor unusually far from the Sun. This rare event, detected by NASA's Swift Observatory, suggests microscopic ice grains are sublimating, challenging existing cometary models. The discovery offers vital insights into how life's building blocks travel across the galaxy, highlighting the diverse origins of planetary materials.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Market expert Aakash K Hindocha suggests buying Amber Enterprises India, BSE, and Hindustan Zinc.  He anticipates Nifty trading between 24750-25250 and Bank Nifty aiming for 56650.

title: 'Strange cure attempt': Chinese woman swallows 8 live frogs for back pain
content: An 82-year-old woman in China swallowed eight live frogs to treat back pain, a local folk remedy. She was later hospitalized with severe abdominal pain and diagnosed with parasites, including sparganum, due to the ingestion. Doctors warn against such practices, citing potential health risks.

title: Vijay's TVK Identifies Karur Venues For Meeting Stampede Victims' Families
content: South superstar Vijay's Tamizhaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) party has identified two venues in Karur for his proposed meeting with the families of those who lost their lives in the stampede at his rally last month, party sources have told NDTV.

title: Bihar Bridge Built For 6 Crores, But Can't Be Used. There's No Approach Road
content: A bridge in Bihar was built at an outlay of approximately Rs 6 crore under the Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana (PMGSY).

title: DK Shivakumar's Update On Bigg Boss Kannada Studio Sealed Over Violations
content: The Karnataka government will lift the seal of the studio where Bigg Boss Kannada is filmed, Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar has assured, allowing the studio authorities time to address the environmental violations over which it had faced action.

title: "Didn't Want To Stay In Jail": How Indian Man Ended Up Fighting For Russia
content: Majoti Sahil Mohamed Hussein, a 22-year-old Indian student from Gujarat's Morbi, who had gone to Russia to study at a university, has been captured by Ukrainian forces after being sent by Russia to fight in its ongoing conflict in Ukraine.

title: "Maliciously Mischaracterised": Jimmy Kimmel On His Charlie Kirk Remarks
content: Comedian Jimmy Kimmel thought his late-night show was over after ABC suspended the program following comments he made over the assassination of political activist Charlie Kirk.

title: Class 10 Student, Mother Harassed In Messages. They Were Sent By Classmate
content: It all started in July when a grade 10 student started to receive indecent and harassing messages from an unknown number. At first, she ignored them. But when the messages continued, the teenager blocked the contact.

title: Speeding Land Rover Defender Rams 6 Cars Near Noida Mall, Causes Huge Wreck
content: A speeding Land Rover Defender lost control and rammed at least six vehicles near a mall in Noida on Wednesday night, police said.

title: WHO Flags "Regulatory Gap", Export Risks After Cough Syrup Tragedy
content: Amid the nationwide outrage over children's deaths caused by adulterated cough syrups in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan, the World Health Organization (WHO) has expressed concern over the "regulatory gap" in screening

title: Court Raps Centre Over "Unwillingness" To Waive Loans For Wayanad Landslide Victims
content: In a stinging observation, the Kerala High Court on Wednesday said that the Union government has "virtually failed" the victims of the 2024 landslides in Wayanad by not exercising its powers to waive off the loans availed by them.

title: India Welcomes Israel-Hamas Deal, PM Modi Praises Netanyahu's Leadership
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has welcomed the US-brokered peace deal between Israel and Hamas that would facilitate the return of those held hostage in Gaza.

title: "Approve Truth Social Post": What Secret Note To Trump On Gaza Deal Said
content: US President Donald Trump was two hours into a roundtable on Antifa with conservative influencers in the White House's Blue Room on Wednesday when Secretary of State Marco Rubio caught his eye. Rubio told Trump he had some news for him.

title: Pharma Firm Owner Was On The Run Since Syrup Tragedy. How He Was Arrested
content: The pharmaceutical company owner, the key accused in the cough syrup tragedy that has claimed over a dozen children's lives in Madhya Pradesh, was arrested by the state police after a dramatic midnight operation.

title: "Wrong, Terribly Wrong": P Chidambaram On PM's 26/11 Barbs At Congress
content: Senior Congress leader and former Home Minister P Chidambaram has hit back after Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that the UPA government did not attack Pakistan after the 26/11 terror attacks in 2008 "because of pressure exerted by some country".

title: All Hostages Will Be Released On Monday: Trump After Gaza Peace Deal
content: US President Donald Trump said he believes all the hostages held in Gaza, including the bodies of those deceased, will be "coming back" Monday after Israel and Hamas agreed to a ceasefire.

title: Video: Moment Blast Occurred In Kanpur, 8 Injured, Firecrackers Seized
content: The explosion was so powerful that the two parked scooters were destroyed, and nearby shops suffered extensive damage.

title: Dulquer Salmaan, Film Stars' Houses Raided Again In Luxury Car Smuggling Case
content: Malayalam superstar Dulquer Salmaan's house and over a dozen locations across South India were raided by the Enforcement Directorate amid a probe into smuggling cartels illegally importing high-end luxury vehicles from Bhutan, sources said.

title: Speeding Porsche Crashes Into Divider On Mumbai Expressway, Driver Injured
content: A high-speed Porsche car collided with a divider on Mumbai's Western Express Highway late last night, leaving the vehicle badly damaged and its driver seriously injured.

title: New York City Sues Facebook, TikTok, Snapchat Over Teen Mental Health Crisis
content: New York City filed a new lawsuit accusing Facebook, Google, Snapchat, TikTok and other online platforms of fueling a mental health crisis among children by addicting them to social media.

title: Elon Musk, Ex-Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal Settle $128 Million Severance Case
content: Elon Musk and the company formerly known as Twitter have agreed to resolve a $128 million lawsuit filed last year by former Chief Executive Officer Parag Agrawal and three other top officials who said they were denied severance payments.

title: Hostage Swap, Troop Withdrawal: What First Phase Of Gaza Deal Includes
content: US President Donald Trump announced on Wednesday that Israel and Hamas have agreed a deal for the first phase of a ceasefire in Gaza, after days of indirect talks in Egypt.

title: THE World University Rankings 2026: Oxford leads again as US universities decline
content: The University of Oxford tops the THE World University Rankings 2026 for the tenth year running, while US universities show signs of decline amid political and funding pressures. Asia’s elite universities stall after years of rapid progress, though wider regional growth continues. The UK maintains strength at the top but faces challenges in lower-ranked institutions. Demographic shifts and policy constraints signal ongoing change in the global higher education landscape, as detailed by Times Higher Education.

title: IPS officer 'suicide': Wife names Hry DGP in complaint; claims husband faced harassment
content: Wife of deceased IPS officer Y Puran Kumar, IAS officer Amneet P Kumar, has lodged a complaint seeking FIR against Haryana DGP Shatrujeet Singh Kapur and Rohtak SP Narendra Bijarnia for abetment to suicide and SC/ST Act violations. She alleges her husband faced systematic persecution and humiliation due to his caste, pushing him to suicide.

title: Op Sindoor showed how air power can swiftly shape outcomes: IAF chief
content: IAF chief Air Chief Marshal A P Singh highlighted the "bold and precise" attacks during Operation Sindoor as a demonstration of air power's effectiveness in shaping military outcomes. The deep precision strikes, conducted from May 7 to 10, restored offensive air action's importance and showcased the force's ability to strike deep inside enemy territory with precision.

title: India's ODI captain: 'Stop the memes' - Mohd Shami on Gill replacing Rohit
content: Veteran pacer Mohammed Shami has backed Shubman Gill's ODI captaincy, urging fans to cease online criticism and memes. Shami emphasized that the decision by the BCCI and selectors is strategic, citing Gill's prior captaincy experience. He reminded supporters that leadership changes are natural in cricket and urged them to support the new captain as he embarks on this new chapter.

title: What's up with Manning? Coaches who have faced him and worked with him weigh in
content: a third-year player has been taunted and clapped back . the quarterback has been booed by road and home fans alike . he has also brought snippets of joy to those wearing Burnt Orange .

title: NFL Power Rankings: Big jumps for Colts and 49ers? How far did the Chargers fall?
content: the Eagles and the Bills suffered one-score losses to the Broncos and Patriots respectively . the Jets are the only winless team after getting trounced by the Cowboys . in addition to our 1-32 rankings, our NFL Nation reporters are looking at every team's fantasy football surprise .

content: the premium live event (PLE) will be headlined by a pair of matches for the men's and women's crown jewel championships . undisputed WWE champion Cody Rhodes will challenge world heavyweight champion seth Rollins in one match .

title: Natalia Bryant credited as creative director for Lakers' preseason hype video
content: the los Angeles lakers turned to a familiar face to be the creative director of their preseason hype video . Natalia Bryant had a star-studded cast for the "Forever Iconic: Purple and Gold Always" video with los Angeles Dodgers star Shohei Ohtani . actor and noted lakers fan Brenda Song also made an appearance .

title: Leicester's 2015-16 Premier League champions: Where are they now?
content: the odds are stacked against any club hoping to repeat Leicester City's unlikely premier league title win . a decade ago, the Foxes were about to become the most improbable title winners of all time . from stars Jamie Vardy and Riyad Mahrez to role players such as Shinji Okazaki and Jeffrey Schlupp, each of that team's key contributors is today .
